case_vignette: A 33-YEAR-OLD WOMAN COMES TO THE PHYSICIAN FOR WEEK-LONG EPISODES OF HEADACHES THAT HAVE OCCURRED EVERY FOUR WEEKS FOR THE LAST YEAR. DURING THESE EPISODES SHE ALSO HAS BOUTS OF LOWER ABDOMINAL PAIN AND BREAST TENDERNESS. SHE IS OFTEN IRRITABLE AT THESE TIMES. HER MENSES OCCUR AT REGULAR 28-DAY INTERVALS WITH MODERATE FLOW. HER LAST MENSTRUAL PERIOD WAS 3 WEEKS AGO. SHE DRINKS TWO TO FIVE BEERS ON SOCIAL OCCASIONS AND USED TO SMOKE A PACK OF CIGARETTES DAILY, BUT STOPPED 6 MONTHS AGO. HER MOTHER AND SISTER HAVE HYPOTHYROIDISM. PHYSICAL EXAMINATION SHOWS NO ABNORMALITIES.
question: WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING IS MOST LIKELY TO CONFIRM THE DIAGNOSIS?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Obstetrics and Gynecology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing week-long episodes of headaches, lower abdominal pain, and breast tenderness every four weeks for the past year. Additionally, I often feel irritable during these times.
How old are you?
I am 33 years old.
Do you notice these symptoms occurring in relation to your menstrual cycle?
Yes, the symptoms occur every four weeks, which matches my regular 28-day menstrual cycle.
Do these symptoms usually resolve after your menstruation begins?
Yes, the symptoms usually resolve after my menstruation begins.
Final Diagnosis: Premenstrual Syndrome (PMS)

The patient also experiences irritability during these times. She is 33 years old. The symptoms align with her regular 28-day menstrual cycle and usually resolve after menstruation begins.
